remarks: Ring homomorphisms preserve multiplication.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 3-Jan-2011.)
statement:
rnghommul.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` R ) $.
rnghommul.2 $e |- X = ran G $.
rnghommul.3 $e |- H = ( 2nd ` R ) $.
rnghommul.4 $e |- K = ( 2nd ` S ) $.
rngohommul $p |- ( ( ( R e. RingOps /\ S e. RingOps /\ F e. ( R RngHom S ) ) /\ ( A e. X /\ B e. X ) ) -> ( F ` ( A H B ) ) = ( ( F ` A ) K ( F ` B ) ) ) $.
